NewWords.WordPhrase: n., v. help 帮助，援助
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He went to the aid of the hurt man.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. hit or knock (sth.) with a dull-sounding blow 砰地碰撞
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I bumped into a tree in the dark.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. put (thoughts, etc.) out of one's mind; remove (sb.) from a position 摒除，排除；解除…的职务
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Peter was dismissed form his post.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. (cause to) become less tense （使）减轻
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I gave him some medicine to ease the pain.

NewWords.WordPhrase: not give up; not let go of 不放弃；抓住
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was imprisoned for 19 years and yet held on to his belief.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. causing a feeling of extreme fear or dislike 恐怖的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Kathy fainted when she saw the horrible sight.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. not patient 不耐烦的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is too impatient with his kids.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 健康状况良好（很好，差）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. All the kids are in good health.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 尽管
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In spite of all his efforts, the boy did not recover.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. （使）倾向于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Mr. Brown inclines towards conservatism.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. place, fix (a piece of equipment) in position for use 安装，安置
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I will definitely have a gas heater installed in my house before this winter.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 间隔
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Trees will be planted on both sides of the street at intervals of 10 meters.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 令人痛苦的；悲惨的，不幸的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He lived a miserable life when he was young.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 乐观的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was optimistic about the future of mankind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. force a way (into or through sth.); be fully understood穿透，刺入；被充分领悟
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Our eyes could not penetrate the darkness.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. advancing gradually by stages over a period of time 进行性的；循序渐进的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. One prominent symptom of the disease is the progressive loss of memory.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. weakness that a person or thing has 缺点，短处
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Despite all his shortcomings, he makes a good friend.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 患…病；苦于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She sometimes suffers from a stomachache.

NewWords.WordPhrase: to a certain extent , partly 一定程度上，部分地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. These statements are, to a degree, all correct.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 个性，特点
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The color of one's eyes is a genetic trait.
